verses.kjv: And the children of Israel did evil in the sight of the LORD: and the LORD delivered them into the hand of Midian seven years.
verses.web: The children of Israel did that which was evil in LORD’s sight, so LORD delivered them into the hand of Midian seven years.
verses.ct: The LORD saw that the people of Israel were evil, so he handed them over to the Midianites for 7 years.

verses.kjv: And the hand of Midian prevailed against Israel: and because of the Midianites the children of Israel made them the dens which are in the mountains, and caves, and strong holds.
verses.web: The hand of Midian prevailed against Israel; and because of Midian the children of Israel made themselves the dens which are in the mountains, the caves, and the strongholds.
verses.ct: Midian's power over Israel was crushing. The Israelites were so desperate that they carved out hiding places in the mountains — dens, caves, and fortified shelters.

verses.kjv: And so it was, when Israel had sown, that the Midianites came up, and the Amalekites, and the children of the east, even they came up against them;
verses.web: So it was, when Israel had sown, that the Midianites, the Amalekites, and the children of the east came up against them.
verses.ct: Every time the Israelites planted their crops, the Midianites would invade, along with the Amalekites and other eastern tribes.

verses.kjv: And they encamped against them, and destroyed the increase of the earth, till thou come unto Gaza, and left no sustenance for Israel, neither sheep, nor ox, nor ass.
verses.web: They encamped against them, and destroyed the increase of the earth, until you come to Gaza. They left no sustenance in Israel, and no sheep, ox, or donkey.
verses.ct: They would set up camp and destroy every crop in the land all the way to Gaza, leaving Israel with nothing to eat — no sheep, no cattle, no donkeys.

verses.kjv: For they came up with their cattle and their tents, and they came as grasshoppers for multitude; for both they and their camels were without number: and they entered into the land to destroy it.
verses.web: For they came up with their livestock and their tents. They came in as locusts for multitude. Both they and their camels were without number; and they came into the land to destroy it.
verses.ct: They swarmed in with their livestock and tents like a plague of locusts. There was no counting them or their camels. They poured into the land and devastated it.

verses.kjv: And Israel was greatly impoverished because of the Midianites; and the children of Israel cried unto the LORD.
verses.web: Israel was brought very low because of Midian; and the children of Israel cried to LORD.
verses.ct: Midian brought Israel to its knees, and the people of Israel cried out to the LORD for help.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the children of Israel cried unto the LORD because of the Midianites,
verses.web: When the children of Israel cried to LORD because of Midian,
verses.ct: When the people of Israel cried out to the LORD because of the Midianites,

verses.kjv: That the LORD sent a prophet unto the children of Israel, which said unto them, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, I brought you up from Egypt, and brought you forth out of the house of bondage;
verses.web: LORD sent a prophet to the children of Israel; and he said to them, “LORD, the God of Israel, says, ‘I brought you up from Egypt, and brought you out of the house of bondage.
verses.ct: the LORD sent a prophet to them. The prophet said, "This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: 'I brought you up out of Egypt and rescued you from slavery.

verses.kjv: And I delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of all that oppressed you, and drave them out from before you, and gave you their land;
verses.web: I delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians and out of the hand of all who oppressed you, and drove them out from before you, and gave you their land.
verses.ct: I saved you from the Egyptians and from everyone who oppressed you. I drove them out ahead of you and gave you their land.

verses.kjv: And I said unto you, I am the LORD your God; fear not the gods of the Amorites, in whose land ye dwell: but ye have not obeyed my voice.
verses.web: I said to you, “I am LORD your God. You shall not fear the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you dwell.” But you have not listened to my voice.’ ”
verses.ct: I told you, "I am the LORD your God. Do not fear the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you now live." But you refused to listen to me.'"

verses.kjv: And there came an angel of the LORD, and sat under an oak which was in Ophrah, that pertained unto Joash the Abiezrite: and his son Gideon threshed wheat by the winepress, to hide it from the Midianites.
verses.web: LORD’s angel came and sat under the oak which was in Ophrah, that belonged to Joash the Abiezrite. His son Gideon was beating out wheat in the wine press, to hide it from the Midianites.
verses.ct: One day the angel of the LORD came and sat under an oak tree in Ophrah that belonged to Joash the Abiezrite. His son Gideon was threshing wheat in a winepress, trying to keep it hidden from the Midianites.

verses.kjv: And the angel of the LORD appeared unto him, and said unto him, The LORD is with thee, thou mighty man of valour.
verses.web: LORD’s angel appeared to him, and said to him, “LORD is with you, you mighty man of valor!”
verses.ct: The angel of the LORD appeared to him and said, "The LORD is with you, mighty warrior!"

verses.kjv: And Gideon said unto him, Oh my Lord, if the LORD be with us, why then is all this befallen us? and where be all his miracles which our fathers told us of, saying, Did not the LORD bring us up from Egypt? but now the LORD hath forsaken us, and delivered us into the hands of the Midianites.
verses.web: Gideon said to him, “Oh, my lord, if LORD is with us, why then has all this happened to us? Where are all his wondrous works which our fathers told us of, saying, ‘Didn’t LORD bring us up from Egypt?’ But now LORD has cast us off, and delivered us into the hand of Midian.”
verses.ct: Gideon replied, "Please, my lord — if the LORD is really with us, then why has all this happened to us? Where are all the miracles our ancestors told us about? They said, 'Didn't the LORD bring us out of Egypt?' But now the LORD has abandoned us and handed us over to Midian."

verses.kjv: And the LORD looked upon him, and said, Go in this thy might, and thou shalt save Israel from the hand of the Midianites: have not I sent thee?
verses.web: LORD looked at him, and said, “Go in this your might, and save Israel from the hand of Midian. Haven’t I sent you?”
verses.ct: The LORD turned to him and said, "Go with the strength you have and rescue Israel from Midian. I am the one sending you."

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Oh my Lord, wherewith shall I save Israel? behold, my family is poor in Manasseh, and I am the least in my father’s house.
verses.web: He said to him, “O Lord, how shall I save Israel? Behold, my family is the poorest in Manasseh, and I am the least in my father’s house.”
verses.ct: Gideon said, "But Lord, how can I possibly save Israel? My clan is the weakest in the whole tribe of Manasseh, and I'm the least important person in my family."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto him, Surely I will be with thee, and thou shalt smite the Midianites as one man.
verses.web: LORD said to him, “Surely I will be with you, and you shall strike the Midianites as one man.”
verses.ct: The LORD answered, "I will be with you, and you will strike down the entire Midianite army as if it were a single man."

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, If now I have found grace in thy sight, then shew me a sign that thou talkest with me.
verses.web: He said to him, “If now I have found favor in your sight, then show me a sign that it is you who talk with me.
verses.ct: Gideon said, "If I've truly found favor with you, give me a sign that it's really you speaking to me.

verses.kjv: Depart not hence, I pray thee, until I come unto thee, and bring forth my present, and set it before thee. And he said, I will tarry until thou come again.
verses.web: Please don’t go away until I come to you, and bring out my present, and lay it before you.” He said, “I will wait until you come back.”
verses.ct: Please don't leave until I come back with an offering to set before you." The LORD replied, "I'll wait until you return."

verses.kjv: And Gideon went in, and made ready a kid, and unleavened cakes of an ephah of flour: the flesh he put in a basket, and he put the broth in a pot, and brought it out unto him under the oak, and presented it.
verses.web: Gideon went in and prepared a young goat and unleavened cakes of an ephah of meal. He put the meat in a basket and he put the broth in a pot, and brought it out to him under the oak, and presented it.
verses.ct: Gideon went inside and prepared a young goat and made unleavened bread from an ephah of flour. He put the meat in a basket and the broth in a pot, then carried it all out and presented it to him under the oak tree.

verses.kjv: And the angel of God said unto him, Take the flesh and the unleavened cakes, and lay them upon this rock, and pour out the broth. And he did so.
verses.web: The angel of God said to him, “Take the meat and the unleavened cakes, and lay them on this rock, and pour out the broth.” He did so.
verses.ct: The angel of God told him, "Place the meat and the unleavened bread on this rock, and pour the broth over them." Gideon did as he was told.

verses.kjv: Then the angel of the LORD put forth the end of the staff that was in his hand, and touched the flesh and the unleavened cakes; and there rose up fire out of the rock, and consumed the flesh and the unleavened cakes. Then the angel of the LORD departed out of his sight.
verses.web: Then LORD’s angel stretched out the end of the staff that was in his hand, and touched the meat and the unleavened cakes; and fire went up out of the rock and consumed the meat and the unleavened cakes. Then LORD’s angel departed out of his sight.
verses.ct: Then the angel of the LORD touched the meat and bread with the tip of the staff in his hand. Fire blazed up from the rock and consumed the meat and the unleavened bread completely. Then the angel of the LORD vanished from his sight.

verses.kjv: And when Gideon perceived that he was an angel of the LORD, Gideon said, Alas, O LORD God! for because I have seen an angel of the LORD face to face.
verses.web: Gideon saw that he was LORD’s angel; and Gideon said, “Alas, Lord LORD! Because I have seen LORD’s angel face to face!”
verses.ct: When Gideon realized that this had been the angel of the LORD, he cried out, "Oh no, Lord GOD! I have seen the angel of the LORD face to face!"

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto him, Peace be unto thee; fear not: thou shalt not die.
verses.web: LORD said to him, “Peace be to you! Don’t be afraid. You shall not die.”
verses.ct: But the LORD said to him, "Peace! Don't be afraid. You are not going to die."

verses.kjv: Then Gideon built an altar there unto the LORD, and called it Jehovahshalom: unto this day it is yet in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.
verses.web: Then Gideon built an altar there to LORD, and called it “LORD is Peace.” To this day it is still in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.
verses.ct: So Gideon built an altar there to the LORD and named it "The LORD Is Peace." It still stands to this day in Ophrah, which belongs to the Abiezrites.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass the same night, that the LORD said unto him, Take thy father’s young bullock, even the second bullock of seven years old, and throw down the altar of Baal that thy father hath, and cut down the grove that is by it:
verses.web: That same night, LORD said to him, “Take your father’s bull, even the second bull seven years old, and throw down the altar of Baal that your father has, and cut down the Asherah that is by it.
verses.ct: That same night, the LORD said to him, "Take your father's bull — the second bull, the one that is 7 years old — and tear down your father's altar to Baal. Cut down the Asherah pole standing beside it.

verses.kjv: And build an altar unto the LORD thy God upon the top of this rock, in the ordered place, and take the second bullock, and offer a burnt sacrifice with the wood of the grove which thou shalt cut down.
verses.web: Then build an altar to LORD your God on the top of this stronghold, in an orderly way, and take the second bull, and offer a burnt offering with the wood of the Asherah which you shall cut down.”
verses.ct: Then build a proper altar to the LORD your God on top of this high place. Take the second bull and offer it as a burnt offering, using the wood from the Asherah pole you cut down."

verses.kjv: Then Gideon took ten men of his servants, and did as the LORD had said unto him: and so it was, because he feared his father’s household, and the men of the city, that he could not do it by day, that he did it by night.
verses.web: Then Gideon took ten men of his servants, and did as LORD had spoken to him. Because he feared his father’s household and the men of the city, he could not do it by day, but he did it by night.
verses.ct: So Gideon took 10 of his servants and did exactly what the LORD told him. But because he was afraid of his father's household and the men of the town, he did it at night instead of during the day.

verses.kjv: And when the men of the city arose early in the morning, behold, the altar of Baal was cast down, and the grove was cut down that was by it, and the second bullock was offered upon the altar that was built.
verses.web: When the men of the city arose early in the morning, behold, the altar of Baal was broken down, and the Asherah was cut down that was by it, and the second bull was offered on the altar that was built.
verses.ct: When the townspeople got up early the next morning, they found the altar of Baal torn down, the Asherah pole beside it cut down, and the second bull burned on a newly built altar.

verses.kjv: And they said one to another, Who hath done this thing? And when they enquired and asked, they said, Gideon the son of Joash hath done this thing.
verses.web: They said to one another, “Who has done this thing?” When they inquired and asked, they said, “Gideon the son of Joash has done this thing.”
verses.ct: They asked each other, "Who did this?" After investigating, they found out: "Gideon son of Joash did it."

verses.kjv: Then the men of the city said unto Joash, Bring out thy son, that he may die: because he hath cast down the altar of Baal, and because he hath cut down the grove that was by it.
verses.web: Then the men of the city said to Joash, “Bring out your son, that he may die, because he has broken down the altar of Baal, and because he has cut down the Asherah that was by it.”
verses.ct: The men of the town demanded of Joash, "Bring out your son! He must die for tearing down Baal's altar and cutting down the Asherah pole beside it."

verses.kjv: And Joash said unto all that stood against him, Will ye plead for Baal? will ye save him? he that will plead for him, let him be put to death whilst it is yet morning: if he be a god, let him plead for himself, because one hath cast down his altar.
verses.web: Joash said to all who stood against him, “Will you contend for Baal? Or will you save him? He who will contend for him, let him be put to death by morning! If he is a god, let him contend for himself, because someone has broken down his altar!”
verses.ct: But Joash stood up to the crowd and said, "Are you really going to fight Baal's battles for him? Are you going to rescue him? Anyone who defends Baal should be put to death by morning! If Baal is truly a god, let him defend himself — after all, it's his altar that was torn down."

verses.kjv: Therefore on that day he called him Jerubbaal, saying, Let Baal plead against him, because he hath thrown down his altar.
verses.web: Therefore on that day he named him Jerub-Baal, saying, “Let Baal contend against him, because he has broken down his altar.”
verses.ct: From that day on, Gideon was called Jerubbaal, meaning "Let Baal contend against him," because he had torn down Baal's altar.

verses.kjv: Then all the Midianites and the Amalekites and the children of the east were gathered together, and went over, and pitched in the valley of Jezreel.
verses.web: Then all the Midianites and the Amalekites and the children of the east assembled themselves together; and they passed over, and encamped in the valley of Jezreel.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, all the Midianites, Amalekites, and eastern tribes joined forces, crossed the Jordan, and set up camp in the Valley of Jezreel.

verses.kjv: But the Spirit of the LORD came upon Gideon, and he blew a trumpet; and Abiezer was gathered after him.
verses.web: But LORD’s Spirit came on Gideon, and he blew a trumpet; and Abiezer was gathered together to follow him.
verses.ct: Then the spirit of the LORD came upon Gideon. He blew a trumpet, and the clan of Abiezer rallied behind him.

verses.kjv: And he sent messengers throughout all Manasseh; who also was gathered after him: and he sent messengers unto Asher, and unto Zebulun, and unto Naphtali; and they came up to meet them.
verses.web: He sent messengers throughout all Manasseh, and they also were gathered together to follow him. He sent messengers to Asher, and to Zebulun, and to Naphtali; and they came up to meet them.
verses.ct: He sent messengers throughout all of Manasseh, and they rallied behind him too. He also sent messengers to Asher, Zebulun, and Naphtali, and they marched out to join him.

verses.kjv: And Gideon said unto God, If thou wilt save Israel by mine hand, as thou hast said,
verses.web: Gideon said to God, “If you will save Israel by my hand, as you have spoken,
verses.ct: Gideon said to God, "If you are truly going to use me to save Israel, as you promised,

verses.kjv: Behold, I will put a fleece of wool in the floor; and if the dew be on the fleece only, and it be dry upon all the earth beside, then shall I know that thou wilt save Israel by mine hand, as thou hast said.
verses.web: behold, I will put a fleece of wool on the threshing floor. If there is dew on the fleece only, and it is dry on all the ground, then I’ll know that you will save Israel by my hand, as you have spoken.”
verses.ct: then here's what I'll do: I'm going to lay a wool fleece on the threshing floor tonight. If there's dew only on the fleece in the morning and the ground all around it is dry, then I'll know for sure that you will save Israel through me, just as you said."

verses.kjv: And it was so: for he rose up early on the morrow, and thrust the fleece together, and wringed the dew out of the fleece, a bowl full of water.
verses.web: It was so; for he rose up early on the next day, and pressed the fleece together, and wrung the dew out of the fleece, a bowl full of water.
verses.ct: That's exactly what happened. When Gideon got up early the next morning, he squeezed the fleece and wrung out enough dew to fill an entire bowl with water.

verses.kjv: And Gideon said unto God, Let not thine anger be hot against me, and I will speak but this once: let me prove, I pray thee, but this once with the fleece; let it now be dry only upon the fleece, and upon all the ground let there be dew.
verses.web: Gideon said to God, “Don’t let your anger be kindled against me, and I will speak but this once. Please let me make a trial just this once with the fleece. Let it now be dry only on the fleece, and on all the ground let there be dew.”
verses.ct: Then Gideon said to God, "Please don't be angry with me — let me ask just one more time. Let me test the fleece once more. This time, let the fleece be dry and let the ground all around it be covered with dew."

verses.kjv: And God did so that night: for it was dry upon the fleece only, and there was dew on all the ground.
verses.web: God did so that night; for it was dry on the fleece only, and there was dew on all the ground.
verses.ct: God did exactly that during the night. The fleece alone was dry, and dew covered all the ground around it.
